show.title: Mermaids
show.headline: Here's a real mother for you!

event.title: <show-title>Mermaids</show-title>
event.headline: As always, Cher is Mother!
event.description:
“Please, God, don't let me fall in love and want to do disgusting things.”

Bildungsroman! Excuse me. I didn’t mean to shout – that’s just how that word comes flying out of me. We know the classic coming-of-age narrative well. It’s a staple of film and literature. GREAT EXPECTATIONS. STAND BY ME. ALMOST FAMOUS. We get it. In Richard Benjamin and June Roberts’ adaptation of Patty Dann’s novel Mermaids, Winona Ryder comes of age for the...I don’t know, fourth or fifth time? Ryder stayed coming-of-age in her early career! Picture it: 1963. Sicily. Massachusetts. Neurotic and chaotically uptight teenager Charlotte Flax (Ryder) has just moved to Eastport with her quirky, water-fixated sister Kate (Christina Ricci) and her brassy mother, Rachel (IT'S CHER!). Charlotte rejects her mother’s freewheeling and sexually audacious lifestyle, preferring to pursue a chaste path of piety. But our desires and fixations often get the better of us and can lead to anxiety and self-doubt, especially when we have the sneaking suspicion that we may, in fact, be other. What we want can run counter to what we want to want, if that makes any sense. Charlotte’s pray-the-lust-away antics and Cher’s dragged up styling provide MERMAIDS with plenty of queer-coded gems for the mining. Add Bob Hoskins serving his patented brand of daddy to the mix and a poppin' soundtrack of early '60s bops and we’ve got a truly classic film ready for the Queer Film Theory 101 treatment. Sing it, Cher! Does he love me? I wanna know. How can I tell if he loves me so?

show.title: Brokeback Mountain: 20th Anniversary
show.headline: Love is a force of nature

show.title: Sister Midnight
show.headline: A rebellious small-town misfit breaks free from the shackles of domesticity

event.title: <show-title>Sister Midnight</show-title> <event-type-title>w/Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Director     Karan Kandhari Live in Person
event.description:
In-person Q&A with director Karan Kandhari

Presented in Hindi with English subtitles

In SISTER MIDNIGHT, the audacious debut feature from London-based Indian artist and filmmaker Karan Kandhari, rebellious small-town misfit Uma (acclaimed Indian actress Radhika Apte) arrives in Mumbai to find herself totally unsuited to life as a housewife. At odds with her prying neighbors and under the constant oppressive noise and heat of the city, she decides to break free from the shackles of domesticity and follow her own path in this bold, unpredictable, and darkly funny debut. Featuring an eclectic soundtrack (Interpol frontman Paul Banks makes his debut as composer) and singular visual aesthetic, the film world-premiered in Cannes' Directors Fortnight and won the award for Best Film in the Next Wave section at Fantastic Fest.

eventType.title: Live Q&A
eventType.headline: Exclusive conversations with actors and filmmakers
eventType.description: Got a question for the director? Wanna meet the cast? At our special Live Q&A events, we follow the screening with an in-person discussion.

show.title: Dogma
show.headline: Faith is a funny thing

event.title: <show-title>Dogma</show-title> <event-type-title>Resurrected! 25th Anniversary</event-type-title>
event.headline: New 4K remaster including exclusive bonus content
event.description: DOGMA is a satirical fantasy comedy that follows two fallen angels, Bartleby and Loki, who discover a loophole that would allow them to return to Heaven, which would inadvertently undo the creation of the universe. A woman named Bethany, who is struggling with her faith, is tasked with stopping them before their plan succeeds. Along the way, she is joined by various characters, including a muse, a seraphim, and a group of unlikely allies, all as they battle against the forces of heaven and hell. Directed by Kevin Smith, the film combines dark humor, theological questions, and absurdity to explore topics of faith, redemption, and religious mythology. After 25 years off the market, DOGMA serves to be a cult classic with fans, and this new 4K remaster also includes exclusive bonus content only available in theatres.

show.title: Jaws (1975)
show.headline: Steven Spielberg's terrifying creature feature

event.title: <show-title>Jaws (1975)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: A bigger boatload of bite-y fun
event.description:
“This shark, swallow you whole.”

Duh, nuh…duh, nuh…nothing quite says "ah, summer" like watching an elusive giant shark terrorize Amity Island on the big screen. It’s the movie that perfected the summer blockbuster and launched a million toothy (and goofy) knock-offs, but none of them can compete with the bite of Spielberg’s 1975 original. This bona fide American classic has everything you could want from a movie: kids in peril, drunken sea shanties, and Richard Dreyfuss in a cage.

As if that wasn’t enough, this is a Movie Party, so you can live the shark-hunting adventure along with your pals Brody, Hooper, and Quint – minus the salty sea air and actual mortal peril. Featuring shark hats, yellow floatie drink holders (CAUTION: very susceptible to shark attacks), and a boat-shaped bath bomb with a great white shark in the center, it’s the most fourth-wall-busting fun you can have on dry land.

image.altText: JAWS x Alamo Drafthouse merch collection on AlamoMart.com

contentBlocks.paragraphs: Dive into the deep with our exclusive JAWS merchandise! From jaw-dropping apparel to collectible memorabilia, the JAWS x Alamo Drafthouse collection is perfect for every fan of the classic Spielberg thriller. Whether you're hunting for beach-ready tees or shark-inspired accessories, we've got everything you need to show your love for the great white legend. You’re gonna need a bigger shopping cart.

show.headline: Tanjiro and his comrades arrive at their next mission on the Mugen Train

landscapeHeroImage.altText: DEMON SLAYER THE MOVIE: MUGEN TRAIN

portraitHeroImage.altText: DEMON SLAYER THE MOVIE: MUGEN TRAIN

posterImages.altText: DEMON SLAYER THE MOVIE: MUGEN TRAIN

event.title: <show-title>Demon Slayer The Movie: Mugen Train (Dubbed)</show-title> <event-type-title>Re-Release</event-type-title>
event.headline: Featuring a sneak peek of the upcoming DEMON SLAYER: INFINITY CASTLE
event.description:
Featuring a sneak peek of the upcoming DEMON SLAYER: INFINITY CASTLE

Presented in an English dub

Falling forever into an endless dream, Tanjiro and the group have completed their rehabilitation training at the Butterfly Mansion, and they arrive at their next mission on the Mugen Train, where over 40 people have disappeared in a very short period of time. Tanjiro and Nezuko, along with Zenitsu and Inosuke, join one of the most powerful swordsmen within the Demon Slayer Corps, Flame Hashira Kyojuro Rengoku, to face the demon aboard the Mugen Train on track to despair.

show.title: The Surrender
show.headline: A mother and daughter attempt to bring the family patriarch back from the dead

event.title: <show-title>The Surrender</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Intro</event-type-title>
event.headline: Director     Julia Max Live in Person
event.description:
Live intro with filmmaker Julia Max

A fraught mother-daughter relationship is put to a terrifying test when the family patriarch dies, and the grieving mother hires a mysterious stranger to bring her husband back from the dead. As the bizarre and brutal resurrection spirals out of control, both women must confront their differences as they fight for their lives – and for each other.

eventType.title: Live Intro
eventType.headline: Essential context straight from the source
eventType.description: What better way is there to understand a film to have it prefaced by the artist who made it? At our Live Intro screenings, we invite filmmakers and talent to stop by before a film to provide something we could all use a little more of – perspective.

show.title: Crossroads (2002)
show.headline: Britney Spears' coming-of-age movie

event.title: <show-title>Crossroads (2002)</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Britney Spears' coming-of-age movie
event.description:
CROSSROADS tells the story of three childhood friends, Lucy (Britney Spears), Kit (Zoë Saldana), and Mimi (Taryn Manning), who, after eight years apart, rediscover their friendship on a cross-country trip. With barely a plan, practically no money but plenty of dreams, the girls catch a lift with Mimi's handsome friend Ben (Anson Mount) in his convertible. Along the way, they not only gather experiences that will change their lives, but they also discover how important it is to hold onto their hearts' desires.

Your ticket includes the following props:

  • Globe keychain
  • Feather earrings
  • Butterfly kerchief
  • Road trip map

show.title: 28 Days Later
show.headline: Danny Boyle’s nerve-shredding exercise in gritty horror

event.title: <show-title>28 Days Later</show-title> <event-type-title>Re-Issue</event-type-title>
event.headline: Danny Boyle’s nerve-shredding exercise in gritty horror
event.description: Animal rights activists free a group of infected chimpanzees to horrifying results in this speculative sci-fi horror effort from writer Alex Garland and director Danny Boyle. Waking from a coma in a deserted London hospital 28 days later, bicycle courier Jim (Cillian Murphy) takes to the deserted city streets in a state of mystified confusion. Joining forces with another group of survivors following a terrifying encounter in a seemingly abandoned church, Jim soon learns the truth behind the deserted streets and the menacing creatures that lurk in the shadows. It's soon revealed that the chimpanzees had been harboring a deadly virus that sends its victims into a furious, murderous rage, and in the days following the initial exposure, the entire population was nearly wiped out due to the resulting homicidal rampage. Is there still a glimmer of hope for humanity, or has the deadly "rage" virus found its way to foreign shores and infected the entire planet?

show.title: Summer Wars (Subtitled)
show.headline: A timeless epic exploring life in the digital age

event.title: <show-title>Summer Wars (Subtitled)</show-title> <event-type-title>in 4K</event-type-title>
event.headline: A timeless epic exploring life in the digital age
event.description:
Presented in Japanese with English subtitles

Kenji is a shy, part-time moderator for OZ, the virtual reality world that powers everyday life, until pretty and popular Natsuki recruits him to be her fake boyfriend. While posing as an affluent suitor to Natsuki’s family, Kenji finds that a rogue A.I. program has stolen his online identity, and Kenji is accused of hacking OZ and causing real-world catastrophes. As the destruction in OZ throws Natsuki’s family into disarray, Kenji must unite his newfound connections to overcome an impending cyber apocalypse.

Against a backdrop of stunning countryside vistas and virtual spaces bursting with color, SUMMER WARS is a timeless epic that explores life in the digital age from Academy Award®-nominated director Mamoru Hosoda (BELLE).

show.title: Wolf Children (Dubbed)
show.headline: After her werewolf lover dies, a woman must find a way to raise their children

event.title: <show-title>Wolf Children (Dubbed)</show-title> <event-type-title>in 4K</event-type-title>
event.headline: After her werewolf lover dies, a woman must find a way to raise their children
event.description:
Presented in an English dub

College student Hana falls in love with a “wolf man,” and together they have two half-human, half-wolf children, Ame and Yuki. The young family’s happy but humble life comes to an abrupt end when the father is tragically killed during a hunt. After struggling to raise her children in the busy city, Hana boldly decides to move to a dilapidated house in the countryside in hopes that her children may one day decide their own path to happiness – whether “human” or “wolf.”

This heart-wrenching modern fairy tale is a staggering work of beauty and emotion from Academy Award®-nominated director Mamoru Hosoda. Rich with gorgeous animation and set to a poignant musical score, WOLF CHILDREN is a sweeping tale about self-discovery and the bonds of family.

show.title: How To Train Your Dragon (2025)
show.headline: A live-action reimagining of the film that launched the beloved franchise

event.title: <show-title>How To Train Your Dragon (2025)</show-title> <event-type-title>Family Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Featuring fun props and crafts that kids and dragons will both enjoy
event.description:
From three-time Oscar® nominee and Golden Globe winner Dean DeBlois, the creative visionary behind DreamWorks Animation’s acclaimed HOW TO TRAIN YOUR DRAGON trilogy, comes a stunning live-action reimagining of the film that launched the beloved franchise.

On the rugged isle of Berk, where Vikings and dragons have been bitter enemies for generations, Hiccup (Mason Thames; THE BLACK PHONE, For All Mankind) stands apart. The inventive yet overlooked son of Chief Stoick the Vast (Gerard Butler, reprising his voice role from the animated franchise), Hiccup defies centuries of tradition when he befriends Toothless, a feared Night Fury dragon. Their unlikely bond reveals the true nature of dragons, challenging the very foundations of Viking society. With the fierce and ambitious Astrid (BAFTA nominee Nico Parker; DUMBO, The Last of Us) and the village’s quirky blacksmith Gobber (Nick Frost; SNOW WHITE AND THE HUNTSMAN, SHAUN OF THE DEAD) by his side, Hiccup confronts a world torn by fear and misunderstanding. As an ancient threat emerges, endangering both Vikings and dragons, Hiccup’s friendship with Toothless becomes the key to forging a new future. Together, they must navigate the delicate path toward peace, soaring beyond the boundaries of their worlds and redefining what it means to be a hero and a leader.

Your ticket includes the following props/crafts:

  • Dragon kites
  • Plasma glow teeth
  • A bag of dragon nip (catnip)
  • Viking helmet decorating craft kit

While posing as an affluent suitor to Natsuki’s family, Kenji finds that a rogue A.I. program has stolen his online identity, and Kenji is accused of hacking OZ and causing real-world catastrophes. As the destruction in OZ throws Natsuki’s family into disarray, Kenji must unite his newfound connections to overcome an impending cyber apocalypse.

Against a backdrop of stunning countryside vistas and virtual spaces bursting with color, SUMMER WARS is a timeless epic that explores life in the digital age from Academy Award®-nominated director Mamoru Hosoda (BELLE).

eventType.title: Special Event
eventType.headline: For Movie Lovers, by Movie Lovers
eventType.description: Whether it’s a movie-inspired feast, an interactive party, or a screening paired with a live performance, we love sharing the movies we love in new and exciting ways.

show.title: How To Train Your Dragon (2025)
show.headline: A live-action reimagining of the film that launched the beloved franchise

event.title: <show-title>How To Train Your Dragon (2025)</show-title> <event-type-title>3D Early Access</event-type-title>
event.headline: Be among the first to see this live-action reimagining in 3D
event.description:
From three-time Oscar® nominee and Golden Globe winner Dean DeBlois, the creative visionary behind DreamWorks Animation’s acclaimed HOW TO TRAIN YOUR DRAGON trilogy, comes a stunning live-action reimagining of the film that launched the beloved franchise.

On the rugged isle of Berk, where Vikings and dragons have been bitter enemies for generations, Hiccup (Mason Thames; THE BLACK PHONE, For All Mankind) stands apart. The inventive yet overlooked son of Chief Stoick the Vast (Gerard Butler, reprising his voice role from the animated franchise), Hiccup defies centuries of tradition when he befriends Toothless, a feared Night Fury dragon. Their unlikely bond reveals the true nature of dragons, challenging the very foundations of Viking society. With the fierce and ambitious Astrid (BAFTA nominee Nico Parker; DUMBO, The Last of Us) and the village’s quirky blacksmith Gobber (Nick Frost; SNOW WHITE AND THE HUNTSMAN, SHAUN OF THE DEAD) by his side, Hiccup confronts a world torn by fear and misunderstanding. As an ancient threat emerges, endangering both Vikings and dragons, Hiccup’s friendship with Toothless becomes the key to forging a new future. Together, they must navigate the delicate path toward peace, soaring beyond the boundaries of their worlds and redefining what it means to be a hero and a leader.

eventType.title: Advance Screening
eventType.headline: Be the first to see your new favorite film.
eventType.description: We work with studios, distributors, and filmmaker pals to give our guests a sneak peek at what’s coming down the line.

heroImage.altText: Hlk crazy rich asians black tie 13 1

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

Upon request at the box office, we provide assistive listening headsets with amplified audio for those individuals who are hard of hearing. For guests who prefer to use their own hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants, our assistive listening headsets have a 3.5mm headphone jack to connect to those devices.

In order to ensure the highest quality experience for all guests, you may not enter a movie after it has started. We’d love to see you up to 30 minutes early. Running late? No worries, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: Baby Day Show
sessionAttributes.description: For our baby day shows, we keep the lights up a bit, and the sound down a bit, so your little one never has to know they even went to the movies!

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, and kids menus. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.
